Hung

Blog Logo

Guest Post

on 12 Jul 2016 , tagged on Poetry  
read

He sits alone,
looking at the window hung on the wall.
He weaves his own griefs,
makes them his own
as if all sadness is his;
sheds tears of words over it
and amasses it in a bucket with ink.
He's never harmed anyone's sleep
for advice, or hugs or kisses.
They say he's a poet.
- Abinash Dash Choudhury

Category

Poetry
